physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Initial ophthalmology exam: Right eye - vision 20/20, normal anterior segment; Left eye - vision 20/50, 2+ conjunctival injection, 2+ anterior chamber cell, posterior synechiae. A few days later: Right eye - 1+ conjunctival injection, 2+ anterior chamber cell, flare, posterior synechiae. At Proctor Foundation: Right eye - vision 20/20, normal intraocular pressure; Left eye - vision 20/25, normal intraocular pressure, 3+ anterior chamber cell, 1+ cell in anterior vitreous. At 9 months: Right eye - 20/20 vision, normal intraocular pressure, 2+ anterior chamber cell, broken posterior synechiae, small posterior subcapsular cataract; Left eye - 20/25 vision, normal intraocular pressure, 1+ anterior chamber cell, broken posterior synechiae, small posterior subcapsular cataract.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initially, the left eye showed more significant findings (2+ conjunctival injection, 2+ anterior chamber cell) than the right eye. Over time, there was a progression in both eyes with increasing anterior chamber cell counts and the development of posterior subcapsular cataracts.
